intro: Senecio howellii, commonly known as Howell's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Senecio howellii is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
